channel.title: Bloomberg Technology

item.title: Salesforce Raises Annual Sales Outlook, Suggesting AI Payoff
item.description: Salesforce Inc. raised its annual sales forecast, suggesting that its AI agent product is on a path to contribute significant revenue.
item.dc:creator: Brody Ford

media:content.media:description: Marc Benioff, chief executive officer of Salesforce Inc., speaks during a keynote at the 2024 Dreamforce conference in San Francisco, California, US, on Tuesday, Sept. 17, 2024. Salesforce is unveiling a pivot in its artificial intelligence strategy this week at its annual Dreamforce conference, now saying that its AI tools can handle tasks without human supervision and changing the way it charges for software.

item.title: HP Plunges After Cutting Profit Outlook on Tariffs, Economy
item.description: HP Inc. dropped about 10% in premarket trading on Thursday after the company’s profit outlook fell short of estimates and it cut the annual earnings forecast, pointing toward a weaker economy and continuing costs from US tariffs on goods from China.
item.dc:creator: Dina Bass

media:content.media:description: Enrique Lores, president and chief executive officer of HP Inc., during the Computex conference in Taipei, Taiwan, on Monday, June 3, 2024. The trade show runs through June 7.

item.title: RBI Paid Record Dividend From Gains in Currency, Interest Income
item.description: India’s central bank gave a record dividend to the government as gains on foreign exchange transactions and interest income boosted its profit.
item.dc:creator: Anup Roy, Subhadip Sircar

media:content.media:description: The Reserve Bank of India (RBI) headquarters building in Mumbai, India, on Friday, Feb. 7, 2025. India's new central bank governor cut interest rates for the first time in almost five years to help spur a slowing economy as global risks intensify.

item.title: Nvidia Eases Concerns About China With Upbeat Sales Forecast
item.description: Nvidia Corp. Chief Executive Officer Jensen Huang soothed investor fears about a China slowdown by delivering a solid sales forecast, saying that the AI computing market is still poised for “exponential growth.”
item.dc:creator: Ian King

item.title: NTT Docomo to Buy Net Bank for $2.9 Billion in Cutthroat Market
item.description: NTT Docomo Inc. is buying SBI Holdings Inc.’s online bank in a ¥420 billion ($2.9 billion) deal to shore up the Japanese mobile carrier’s financial offerings in a hyper-competitive market.
item.dc:creator: Kazu Hirano, Yuki Furukawa

media:content.media:description: An NTT Docomo Inc. store in Tokyo. Photographer: Kiyoshi Ota/Bloomberg

item.title: K-Pop Gears Up for China Comeback After Decade-Long Ban
item.description: South Korea’s top two K-pop labels are preparing for a long-awaited reopening of the Chinese market, with Beijing widely expected to lift its defacto ban on Korean pop performances later this year.
item.dc:creator: Sohee Kim

media:content.media:description: A woman walks past the photograph of Jin, a member of K-pop boy band BTS, near the Hybe Co. headquarters in Seoul.

item.title: Kuaishou Releases Upgrade for Kling Video-Generation AI Tool
item.description: Kuaishou Technology released an update to its Kling video-generation tool to reduce the cost and time to create clips.
item.dc:creator: Luz Ding

media:content.media:description: Kling AI.

item.title: US Tightens China Chip Curbs by Targeting Design Software
item.description: The Trump administration is moving to restrict the sale of chip design software to China, people familiar with the matter said, as the US government evaluates a broader policy announcement on the issue.
item.dc:creator: Jenny Leonard, Mackenzie Hawkins

media:content.media:description: Researchers refine a semiconductor design.

item.title: Delaware AG Seeking Bank to Advise on OpenAI Restructuring
item.description: Delaware’s attorney general is planning to hire an investment bank that would advise her office as it examines OpenAI’s restructuring plans aimed at drawing more investors, according to a person familiar with the matter.
item.dc:creator: Sabrina Willmer, Malathi Nayak

item.title: Alien Invasions Are Expensive
item.description: As long as humans are trading and traveling, plants and animals will be hitching lifts. The tools to track and mitigate the damage are taking on even greater importance.
item.dc:creator: Lara Williams

media:content.media:description: Macrophotography of the abdomen of the Asian predatory hornet (Vespa velutina) perched on a vine and eating a grain of white muscat grapes on the island of Barthelasse in Avignon, France on August 17, 2024. Species classified as invasive in France. (Photo by Antoine Boureau / Hans Lucas / Hans Lucas via AFP) (Photo by ANTOINE BOUREAU/Hans Lucas/AFP via Getty Images)

item.title: DeepSeek Unveils Update to R1 Model
item.description: DeepSeek said it has upgraded the R1 artificial intelligence model that helped propel the Chinese startup to global prominence at the start of this year.
item.dc:creator: Luz Ding

media:content.media:description: The Deepseek logo

item.title: Nvidia CEO Warns That Chinese AI Rivals Are Now ‘Formidable’
item.description: Nvidia Corp. Chief Executive Officer Jensen Huang said that Chinese AI rivals are filling the void left by the departure of US companies from that market, and their technology is becoming more powerful.
item.dc:creator: Ian King, Edward Ludlow

media:content.media:description: Jensen Huang Photographer: David Paul Morris/Bloomberg

item.title: Synopsys Gets Conditional FTC Green Light on $34 Billion Deal
item.description: Chip-design company Synopsys Inc. won approval from the Federal Trade Commission for its planned $34 billion buyout of software developer Ansys Inc. after agreeing to sell assets.
item.dc:creator: Josh Sisco

item.title: Nvidia’s Huang Reacts to US Crackdown on China Visas
item.description: Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang reacts to US Secretary of State Marco Rubio saying the US plans to start revoking visas for Chinese students. He speaks with Ed Ludlow on a special edition of “Bloomberg Technology.”

item.title: Japan Bets on Homegrown Startups to Adapt to a Hotter World
item.description: Japan is hoping startups can help the fifth-biggest carbon dioxide polluter prepare for and adapt to a warmer world.
item.dc:creator: Aaron Clark, Min Jeong Lee

media:content.media:description: A pedestrian under cooling mist sprays in the Ginza district of Tokyo.

item.title: Telegram to Distribute Grok in $300 Million xAI Deal, CEO Durov Says
item.description: Telegram Chief Executive Officer Pavel Durov said early Wednesday that he had agreed to a one-year deal with Elon Musk’s xAI to distribute its Grok chatbot to the platform’s billion-plus users.
item.dc:creator: Jake Rudnitsky

item.title: Vietnam's AI Ambitions Hinge on One $6.8 Billion Tech Company
item.description: FPT Corp. faces challenges from rivals to US tariffs in its global expansion journey.
item.dc:creator: John Boudreau, Nguyen Xuan Quynh

media:content.media:description: A test model of an AI-assisted driving cockpit at FPT Corp.’s headquarters in Hanoi on Feb. 24.

item.title: Salesforce Says AI Has Reduced Hiring of Engineers and Customer Service Workers
item.description: Salesforce Inc. said the use of artificial intelligence tools internally has allowed it to hire fewer workers, another example of a company changing its hiring plans due to the emerging technology.
item.dc:creator: Brody Ford

media:content.media:description: Salesforce headquarters in San Francisco, California, US, on Wednesday, Nov. 29, 2023. Salesforce released earnings figures on November 29.

item.title: Apple to Launch iOS 26, macOS 26 in Major Rebrand Tied to Software Redesigns
item.description: Apple Inc. is planning the most sweeping change yet to its operating system names, part of a software overhaul that extends to all its devices.
item.dc:creator: Mark Gurman

media:content.media:description: Apple’s iOS 18 introduction at WWDC 2024.

item.title: This $7,000 Single-Seat Electric Car Is a Big Hit in Japan
item.description: In the rural suburbs of Hiroshima, a Japanese startup is trying to kick start the nation’s electric vehicle market with the smallest, cheapest car it can possibly make.
item.dc:creator: Nicholas Takahashi

media:content.media:description: KG Motors CEO Kazunari Kusunoki with the mibot.

item.title: Nvidia Earnings Ahead, SpaceX Faces Another Setback | Bloomberg Technology 5/28/2025
item.description: Bloomberg’s Caroline Hyde and Ed Ludlow discuss what investors are expecting from Nvidia’s earnings, which are set to be released after markets close on Wednesday. Plus, SpaceX’s Starship test flight ends in a fiery setback for the Elon Musk-led company. And, Okta CEO Todd McKinnon says his company offers better value than “legacy” tech competitors. (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Victoria’s Secret Security Incident Disrupts Website, Email
item.description: Victoria’s Secret & Co. has stopped some office operations and told employees to avoid using company technology amid a “security incident” that also disrupted the retailer’s online shopping website and some store services.
item.dc:creator: Lara Sanli, Jeff Stone, Lily Meier

media:content.media:description: Pedestrians walk past a Victoria's Secret Stores LLC store in the Xidan shopping area in Beijing, China, on Wednesday, July 15, 2020. The Chinese economy returned to growth in the second quarter, marking an important milestone in the global struggle to recover from the coronavirus pandemic.

item.title: Buyout Firm Vista Nears $2 Billion Deal for Software Maker Acumatica
item.description: Vista Equity Partners is in advanced talks to acquire Acumatica Inc., a software company that helps businesses streamline workflow, according to people with knowledge of the matter.
item.dc:creator: Ryan Gould, Swetha Gopinath

media:content.media:description: High angle view of a businessman using laptop in a restaurant Photographer: FG Trade/E+

item.title: Mercado Pago Will Apply for Argentina Banking License
item.description: Mercado Pago, the digital wallet and financial services arm of MercadoLibre, will request a banking license from Argentina’s central bank as part of its effort to expand its ecosystem, according to a statement Wednesday.
item.dc:creator: Ignacio Olivera Doll, Maria Clara Cobo

media:content.media:description: Mercado Pago app

item.title: Nvidia CEO Huang Says China AI to Move On With or Without US Chips

media:content.media:description: Jensen Huang displays a Blackwell chip during an event in Taipei, Taiwan.

item.title: Fiber Firm Everstream Files Bankruptcy After Debt Struggles
item.description: Fiber-network provider Everstream has filed for bankruptcy in Texas after struggling with its debt load and underperforming rivals.
item.dc:creator: Dorothy Ma

media:content.media:description: Fiber optic cables.

item.title: Nvidia to Have Final Say on Strong Earnings Season for Big Tech
item.description: Nvidia Corp. faces the final test of an earnings season-driven rally that has sent its shares up about 45% from an April low.
item.dc:creator: Jeran Wittenstein, Ryan Vlastelica

item.title: Israel Acknowledges Use of Laser Weapons to Intercept Drones
item.description: Israel has deployed laser weapons during its ongoing war to deflect “scores” of aerial attacks, including from drones, the Defense Ministry said in a statement on Wednesday. This is the first time the country has acknowledged the use of directed-energy technologies in the battlefield.
item.dc:creator: Marissa Newman

media:content.media:description: An Israeli armored personnel carrier near the Gaza border after military operations, in southern Israel, on Wednesday, April 17, 2024. Iran’s unprecedented attack on Saturday night, lasting no more than several hours, came with a steep price tag, and points to the sheer expense of air anti-missile as nations such as Iran improve their drone and missile capabilities. Photographer: Kobi Wolf/Bloomberg

item.title: Anthropic Appoints Netflix Co-Founder Reed Hastings to Board
item.description: Board seeks to balance AI’s business interests, responsibilities to society
item.dc:creator: Shirin Ghaffary

media:content.media:description: Reed Hastings, co-founder and chief executive officer of Netflix Inc., during the Milken Institute Global Conference in Beverly Hills, California, U.S., on Monday, Oct. 18, 2021. The event convenes the best minds in the world to tackle its most urgent challenges and to help realize its most exciting opportunities.

item.title: Andreessen Horowitz-Backed Startup Is Trying to Build a Safer VPN
item.dc:creator: Gian Volpicelli

media:content.media:description: The aftermath of a Russian drone strike in Kyiv in March.
